Class ImageHandler

java.lang.Object
  ImageHandler

public class ImageHandler
extends java.lang.Object

ImageHandler - this class is not meant to be instantiated This class contains several static methods to read, create, and test the equality of images

Version:
1.0
Author:
Dillon Hammond

createNewImage

public static void createNewImage(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Pixel>> image,
                                  java.lang.String newFilePath)
createNewImage - This method writes a new image of a specified format to the disk

Parameters:
image - The double nested ArrayList of Pixel objects representing an image
newFilePath - The path where the new file will be created

equals

public static boolean equals(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Pixel>> imageA,
                             java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Pixel>> imageB,
                             double tolerance)
equals - A method to test the equality of two images based off percent pixel match and a tolerance for error

Parameters:
imageA - The first image to compare
imageB - The second image to compare
tolerance - A percent represented as a decimalo indicating the maximum allowed difference for two images to equal each other
Returns:
boolean Whether or not the iamges were equal within tolerance

readImage

public static java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Pixel>> readImage(java.lang.String path)
                                                                 throws java.io.IOException
readImage - A mehtod that takes in a file path and turns the picture at that location into a doubly, nested ArrayList of Pixel objects

Parameters:
path - The absolute (not relative) path to the image file
Returns:
ArrayList> The image converted into Pixel objects
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Exception is thrown if there is an issue reading the image file
